## **Data exploration & summarizing in R**

```{r}
library(GGally)
library(skimr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
view(diamonds) #look at the built-in dataset
```

```{r}
#exploring the dataset
names(diamonds)
```

```{r}
dim(diamonds)
```

```{r}
summary(diamonds)
```

```{r}
head(diamonds)
```

```{r}
tail(diamonds)
```

```{r}
skimr::skim(diamonds)
```

```{r}
#create a pairs plot
GGally::ggpairs(diamonds)
```

```{r}
#pairs plot with 3 columns
GGally::ggpairs(diamonds, columns = 5:7, ggplot2::aes(colour = color))
```

```{r}
#Create a basic ggplot scatterplot of diamond price (price) as a function of size (carat)

ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = carat, y = price, colour = color)) +
  geom_point()
```

```{r}
#Create a histogram showing the distribution of values in the carat column
ggplot(data = diamonds, aes(x = carat, fill = color)) +
  geom_histogram()
```
